snippet: Prosecutors indicted a Japanese journalist on charges he defamed South Korea’s president by reporting rumors that she was absent for seven hours during the April ferry disaster because she was with a man.
abstract: South Korean prosecutors indict Japanese journalist Tatsuya Kato on charges he defamed South Korea’s Pres Park Geun-hye by reporting rumors that she was absent for seven hours during the April ferry disaster because she was with a man.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors indicted a Japanese journalist on charges he defamed South Korea’s president by reporting rumors that she was absent for seven hours during the April ferry disaster because she was with a man.

headline.main: South Korea: Journalist Is Charged Over Report on Rumors About President
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Journalist Is Charged Over Report on Rumors About President
